column4: is there anyway to speedup konquerer's web page browsing speed.. its god awfully slow
prelink
how
run prelink on all the binaries
apt-get install prelink
thanks
then prelink the libraries and binaries
ask in #kde though first
because I don't know why it's not already prelinked... there must be some reason...
ah, ok
note, I don't knowhow safe this is
I am very pleased about KDE 3.4
aye
what do you like about it?
Well first of all very fast.. also the new interface reminds me of an os x like feeling but with still keeping the linux roots intact
do you think there was anything unclear about the interface? for example, sometimes I think Konqueror's sidebar is too cluttered.. I barely useit
yes the sidebar likes to try to grab your attention a little too much sometimes.. its not too bad but I did notice that
sometimes toobars appear to be stuffed with buttons -- I almost never use any of them
Yes but gnomes toolbar I find with that "spacial" stuff they use is too minimalistic
also, I think this translucency thing in KDE was rushed;  why enable support for it when the underlying infrastructure isn't stable??

I am having no problems with translcuentsy.. on my notebook.. i installed kubuntu and it started right up with nvidia drivers already configured and ready to go.. I get barely any cpu use and it has been a very clean install with very little loose ends to catch up on... cleanest linux installation yet
also, foci would have also worked (foci and focuss are synonyms)
hmm, I have an nvidia ti4200 and it gets very laggy with kcompmgr runnimng.
